reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two years ago to the day, we visited the Mayan Palace, and I wrote my first review. I went back on before we left, and I was amazed at some of the postings. Maybe there is another Mayan Palace with the negatives the writers put in.
reviews.title: Wonderful vacation spot!

reviews.text: Again, we had a wonderful time. We got the highest floor of the tower ( 8th), had a view of the lagoon and the ocean from our balcony and living room. Rather than notice the good part of the view, other reviewers seem to notice a phone tower and nothing else. I had to look for it to see what they meant. We are not owners, but we exchanged through Trading Places.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, awesome view, great beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was gorgeous, as always. The Sea of Cortez/CAlifornia was warm and clear, calm some days and easy waves to jump on other days. This area has the second highest and lowest tides in the world, so you have to wait for high tide unless you want to walk a very long way to get to the sea.
reviews.title: Lay Back Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was directly behind us, and when it got hot and it was low tide, I enjoyed swimming in it. It's clear, clean and has a perfect temperature. The indoor pool was open and looked nice, but it's June, why be indoors? So, we never tried it.
reviews.title: Mayan Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are more activities than I was interested in trying --Take Tues. as a typical day. For adults, at 9:15 there is stretching, 10: volley ball game, ditto at 11; 12; aquaerobics; 1- some days it was coctail making....and most important----sampling; other days, dance lessons; 2 -Mexican bingo and ping pong tournaments; 3 PM - blackjack and tequila volleyball ( pool); 4 PM- volleyball or soccer on the beach; 8:30- beach party ( hilarious games and fun or music with a live band and group dances); karaoke, bingo, blackjack; Mexican fiesta with superb dancing on stage. The activities staff handled all this in the warmest, friendliest manner. They handled the kids in the same way. They were incredibly polite and good with the kids. There are also kids' activities from 10 AM on. Everything is family friendly.
reviews.title: We only visited, but...

reviews.text: Already in the middle of nowhere, if you are not a Mayan Palace Club member, you get a room overlooking the tops of temporary buildings and what looks like a nuclear power plant in the middle of the desert. No glimpse of the Sea of Cortez without leaning off the balcony and stretching to look around your building. Stayed here in exchange for a beautiful timeshare in Hawaii through RCI. Flew to Phoenix & rented a car. Can only rent from a few companies if plan to drive across border to Mexico. Must also purchases Mexican liability insurance. Loaded up with groceries in Phoenix--good thing, because nearest store to this resort is 20 miles away. Got to Puerto Penasco after dark; got lost trying to find resort. Cell phones (Verizon at least) do not work there. At check in, mobbed by people trying to sell timeshares at this property. Gave us a room in the oldest building, furthest from the lobby, pools, beach, activities. Next to a Mayan Palace building under construction (until at least 2020 according to one employee,) where the worker(s) hammered all day during the week. Room had a view of what looked like a nuclear power plant in the desert. Resort manager would not give us a room with a view of the Cortez Sea, though many available. Said he was saving those for "owners." Many rooms facing ocean stayed empty all week. Could not reach room service b/c phone busy for hours. All employees told to tell guests they were "100% full," though that was not true. That's how they explained everything away. Checked out 2 days early & stayed in gorgeous hotel in Scottsdale!
reviews.title: Do not stay here unless you are a member of the Mayan Palace Club

reviews.text: We came from Phoenix and did not intend to engage in a Timeshare presentation; however, members of the staff and other types continue to "request a favor" of attending - saying "it won't even take an hour." However, once you agree the nightmare begins - 3 plus hours of incredibly dishonest and finally rude behavior ( my husband teaches University Finance and was amazed at how inaccurate the sales claims were - plus, in Mexico, you have NO consumer protections ). After we finally escaped, they continued to call and come up to us about new "offers" - then, while having breakfast, one of the waiters came up to us and said we had dishonored him or something. Rooms were ok, but non-owners get the worst rooms with no view and broken furniture. Will never go back.
reviews.title: OK Place but Timeshare Pitches Ruin Everything!
Had a Great week at Mayan
reviews.text: My wife and 2 kids and I went to the Mayan Palace for Spring Break along with my dad and his wife. We had a very nice time!
We stayed in a 1 bedroom unit on the 4th floor of the newer high rise section. The unit was very large and the kids slept on the pull out beds that come out from under the sofas.
reviews.title: Great safe place to relax and spend time with family – looking for a hopping place near a town, go elsewhere.

reviews.text: The unit has a small kitchenette with sink, dorm fridge, 2 burner electric stove, toaster, coffee maker, blender and all the plates, cups etc. We ate in our room every day to save money and it worked out fine. We cooked dinner in our room twice with no problems also. I purchased shrimp in town at the fish markets on the main tourist street and has a banquet meal for about $25 for 6 people.
reviews.title: Very nice resort but hard to get to.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived day after Christmas, during their slow season. Overall very nice experience. The food was excellent, we loved the restaurant (buffet was top notch!) and waiters very friendly. Pool cafe also good. Our suite in Building 2 (newer tower) was very spacious, clean and nicely decorated although furniture was showing some wear. Kitchenette basic but good, had microwave, toaster, blender and other basics. Do note: tile floors throughout means all sound carries to your room from the hallway and floors above. I am a light sleeper and would have appreciated something to dampen the sound, as well as dual paned-glass so I didn't hear every service cart that rolled by the window (we were on the third floor.) I will also confirm the king bed in our room was ultra hard, and I like a firm bed... but this was probably hardest bed I'd ever slept on. The beach is awesome, stretches on for miles and you feel like you have it to yourself. Pool was very nice too, enjoyed the poolside beds for lounging and reading when it was warm enough. Seemed like they had some fun activities for kids, although ours weren't with us so I was only observing from a distance.
reviews.title: Nice Resort in the Middle of Nowhere

reviews.text: By far, the biggest problem I had with this resort was the front desk staff -- awful. No sense of customer service, everything was "no", or they would just ignore your request. Check in felt shady: we asked if upgrade to ocean view was possible and the clerk said he would check. Manager was called over, he never looked us in the eye, just stared down at computer screen for two minutes (while he picked our room assignment) and then left. Clerk took over computer again, after about five minutes handed us our room assignment without addressing our request to see if an upgrade was possible. I had to clarify if we were getting an oceanview, and he said no, it was not available. Seemed very insincere and unconcerned. Then we were immediately told to go sit on a sofa in the lobby and wait to meet the concierge, who of course is part of the timeshare sales team and is there to pin you down to an appointment time for their presentation. We were not at all interested and had no intention of spending a morning with their sales team, and still had to spend 20 minutes with this woman. Finally I told her to just call us later in the week to check if we had changed our minds (we didn't). Three times I had to call or approach the front desk staff multiple times to address simple issues: our safe malfuctioned, etc. They would tell you someone was on the way, then when you called back to follow up 40 mins later, there would be an excuse for the delay and they would assure you that NOW someone was really on their way. Not significant but annoying. Check out I felt same attitude from clerk, like he was too cool to care about us. No warmth or sense of customer service, we had to clarify everything and they will do what they want if you don't look things over carefully. We asked to charge everything to our card in pesos because we trust our credit card's conversion more than the hotel. Seemed like their math was always slightly off. Management needs to take a look at customer service training for their front desk team. This place charges too much to make you feel like dirt when they are supposed to be welcoming you or saying farewell.
reviews.title: Excellant stay if you read the reviews in advance---medical facility on site

reviews.text: Other feedback I would validate: they do try to nickle & dime you over everything, and prices are not cheap. Web access, fitness center, cleaning your kitchen upon departure, etc. are all extra fees. The buffet was top notch but was also $28 US for dinner and $18 for breakfast -- in low season. New Year's Eve party was $100 per person for dinner. Much better meal deals available in town, but that is a 25 minute drive so not practical every day. Best advice: bring in your own breakfast and a couple easy meal alternatives. We would do the buffet once a day and did all the other meals in our room or in town. That worked great, and helped me not gain too much weight! Tip: bring your own roll of paper towels or napkins, none are provided in kitchen.
reviews.title: This place is a sham...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although I'm pointing out the problems we had to forwarn others, OVERALL I really liked the Mayan Palace and would go back, especially with our kids since it is drivable distance for us.
reviews.title: Two weeks of golf and leisure at a really nice resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: GPS Coordinates for mapping: 31.24525, 113.26384
reviews.title: A GREAT GETAWAY FOR RELAXATION

reviews.text: We visited with our 3 children and had an amazing time. I firmly believe that the the negative reviews are from people who either didn't do any kind of research and/or expected bargain basement "Old Mexico" prices at this great resort.
reviews.title: A Great and Out of the Way Resort

reviews.text: First off, the place IS remote. About a 20 minute (but simple) drive from the town of Puerto Penasco with zero in between. We knew this going in and didnt mind. If you want to be in the middle of town this is not your place.
reviews.title: would never go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next, if you want to prepare your own meals you need at least the 1 bedroom unit. The studio has no kitchen. This is also something that was easy for us to find out and we planned accordingly. Without a kitchen you are limited to the resort restaurants or driving to town.
reviews.title: No worries, be happy!

reviews.text: We found every single employee to be super nice, even the guy watering the plants and the guy pushing the laundry cart. At LEAST 80% of everyone I talked to spoke english, no eggageration.
reviews.title: Beware admittly crooked salespeople!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants serve really good food, the buffets were a big hit with my family. The food is not cheap, but it is very good and is definately cheaper than other resorts we have stayed in.
reviews.title: Just relax and take a chill pill!
